textBody: A contingent of Chinese companies led by technology giant Huawei is turning the world's biggest wireless trade fair into an opportunity to show their muscle in the face of Huawei's blacklisting by Western nations concerned about cybersecurity and escalating tensions with the U.S. over TikTok, spy balloons and computer chips.

title: Virginia Gov. Glenn Youngkin: China using 'trojan horse' to reap taxpayer benefits
textBody: Virginia Gov. Glenn Youngkin on Sunday touted a recent decision to withdraw his state from the running for a $3.5 billion Ford electric vehicle-battery plant because of its involvement with a Chinese-based company as GOP governors look to combat the foreign adversary.

title: Colombian administrative court conducts two-hour hearing entirely in the metaverse
Mexican states in hot competition over possible Tesla plant
textBody: Mexico is undergoing a fevered competition among states to win a potential Tesla facility in jostling reminiscent of what happens among U.S. cities and states vying to win investments from tech companies.

title: Pentagon investigating server exposed to public
textBody: The Defense Department is digging into a computer server that a cybersecurity researcher discovered exposed a trove of internal U.S. military emails.

title: U.S. commits $2 billion in drones, ammunition, aid to Ukraine on war anniversary
textBody: The Pentagon announced a new package of long-term security assistance for Ukraine on Friday, marking the first anniversary of Russia's invasion with a $2 billion commitment to send more rounds of ammunition and a variety of small, high-tech drones into the fight.

title: Video game review: 'Monster Hunter Rise' (Xbox Series S)
textBody: Monster Hunter Rise, Capcom's latest sequel to its famed action-packed, role-playing franchise, finally moves to Xbox Series X/S and the PlayStation 5 to give new audiences a chance to battle creatures within a wondrous universe.
